Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

Ive just bought a new PC.

Processor IntelÃ‚Â® CoreÃ¢â€žÂ¢ i7-4770 processor (8 x 3.4 GHz, 8 MB cache)

Operating system Windows 8

2 TB SATA, 7200 rpm

16 GB DDR3 RAM

NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 with 1.5 GB GDDR5

Intel Z87 MOBO

Optical drive DVD writer

15-in-1 memory card reader

TV output HDMI x 1

Expansion card slot - PCIe x 1

- PCIe (x16) x 1

Beats Audio Console High Definition Audio 7.1

Cant wait to run KSP on max settings at 1920 x 1080 tonight.

Bit of a step up from my laptop

what do you guys think?, im hoping to get at least 2 years out of it before needing to upgrade,

Activating jealousy nodes...

Jealousy nodes activated...

It's crap, awful, rubbish and terrible. It'll probably blow up on first run and then you'll be sat in a black smoke cloud crying and I shall laugh. Laugh like a jealous guy who has no need to be jealous anymore.

haha, If it blows up, HP will have a nasty phone call heading their way, ill also blame you Monkeh!!

Im at work at the moment, but I tried Blackops on it last night, it looks awesome at full max settings.

Ive left Steam downloading KSP, MW2, Limbo, FTL, Train Sim 2013 and Halflife 2 Episode 2. (most of the newer games on on my Xbox)

Im waiting for a game in a Steam sale or offer that can show off the capabilitys of my new Toy.

Crysis

Far Cry 3

Battlefield 3

Metro: Last Light

Deep Space 3

Tomb Raider (2013)

Grid 2

All supposed to be a bit special in the looks department. Also, Total War: Rome II is going to look incredible when it's released in...ermm, September I think.

Crysis

Far Cry 3

Battlefield 3

Metro: Last Light

Deep Space 3

Tomb Raider (2013)

Grid 2

All supposed to be a bit special in the looks department. Also, Total War: Rome II is going to look incredible when it's released in...ermm, September I think.

Thanks, Thing is, Ive played Far Cry 3, Tomb Raider, Battlefield 3, Skyrim and Crysis on my XB360 so i dont want to be re-paying for them on the PC.

Ill definatley be buying GTA5 and Elder Scrolls online for the PC

Ah well then, in that case I shall leave you with this and bid you a good day.

Oh, what about Eve online, that looks spectacular I'm told, Bioshock Infinite is cool, (yeah yeah, probably had it on xbox goddamit!), Hitman: Absolution, Deus Ex: Human Revolution, Dead Space 3, (did I call it deep space up there...doh!), Starforge looks like it will be incredible in time or maybe Interstellar Marines which looks pretty cool as well.

Crysis 1

Trust me. I have nearly the same rig and I can't still run it on max settings.

Congratulation, PC's are always better to playing games... for most of the time .

(I'm on the PC side)

Edited August 6, 2013 by karolus10
Casual? You can't bring a desktop on the train

Casual? You can't bring a desktop on the train

Tell it to the guy in the picture

Let's see what you've done wrong...You forgot an SSD, your video card is weak and ... windows 8.

The rest looks ok.

haha, If it blows up, HP will have a nasty phone call heading their way

You bought it from HP? No offense but in my opinion that was a bad mistake. How much did you pay for it?

well, it was a moment of weakness whilst in PC world,.

I agree the video card isnt top of the range but hey, its a major step up form my onboard Intel HD3000.

I paid just over a grand for it.

Tell it to the guy in the picture

I mean, running it. Unless you're lucky enough to have a power source available.
altough an i5 and a 760 would've given much more performance for the same price, you got a good pc right there.
